perturbation.original_text: 9. Relationship of Parties. The parties hereto expressly understand and agree that each party is an independent contractor in the performance of each and every part of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Relationship of Parties. The parties hereto expressly understand and agree that each party is a worker in the performance of each and every part of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'independent contractor' to 'worker' creates ambiguity. While the contract intends to establish an independent contractor relationship (avoiding employer responsibilities), some jurisdictions have specific definitions of 'worker' that might blur the lines and imply certain employment rights, thus contradicting the intended independent contractor status.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state employment laws defining 'worker' differently from 'independent contractor'.

perturbation.original_text: e. “Net Revenue” shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company Products, [less third party commissions, equipment sales, delivery costs, taxes, refunds, and credits.
perturbation.changed_text: e. “Net Revenue” shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company Products, [less discretionary deductions deemed appropriate by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing specific, legally definable deductions (like taxes and refunds) with 'discretionary deductions', the definition of 'Net Revenue' becomes vague. This can lead to disputes over commission calculations, as the company could arbitrarily reduce the 'Net Revenue,' contradicting standard business practices and potentially violating implied duties of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, contract law principles regarding clear and unambiguous terms.

perturbation.original_text: 13.  Indemnification. Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.  Indemnification. Company may indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including attorneys’ fees at Company's discretion, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall indemnify' to 'may indemnify' and specifying 'attorneys’ fees at Company's discretion' alters the obligatory nature of indemnification. Standard indemnification clauses provide a guaranteed right to defense and coverage under specific circumstances. By making it discretionary, the clause becomes unenforceable and contradicts the typical understanding of indemnification under commercial law, leaving the Reseller without assured protection against defined liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding indemnification, potential violations of good faith and fair dealing.
